info.title: License Manager API
info.description:
## Welcome!

The License Manager API allows you to create users, modify their names and emails, as well as add and remove roles from users.

### ATTRIBUTES

|Attribute name | Description |
|:------------|--------------|
|accountName | Account name in VTEX License Manager |
|environment | Environment on which you want to run the query e.g. vtexcommercestable |
|userId      | Unique user identification string |
|roleId      | Integer that represents a role, can be looked up on the License Manager UI |

accountName.description: Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL

environment.description: Environment to use. Used as part of the URL.

get.description: Allows you to get a user from the database, using the `userId` as the identifier.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The media type of the body of the request. Default value for license manager protocol is application/json

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: ID from queried user.

405.description: Method Not Allowed - A null `userId` sends the request to a path that is not allowed.

post.description: Allows you to create a user by providing an email (mandatory) and name (optional). The email must be in a valid format. The success response will contain the generated `userId` for that user.

put.description: Allows you to add roles to a particular user or application key by specifying the list of roles' IDs on the request's body.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: ID corresponding to the user

requestBody.description: List of roles' IDs to add to the user or application key.

schema.description: Array containing IDs of the roles

204.description: Success - A no-content response, but the roles were added successfully.

400.description: Bad Request - A userId or role list with invalid format. The message on the body of the response will contain further information.

example.Message: Roles list contains roles that do not exist in this account

500.description: Unexpected error - One possible reason is that the userId is not present on the database.

get.description: Gets roles of a particular user or application key.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The media type of the body of the request. Default value for license manager protocol is application/json

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: ID corresponding to the user

delete.description: Allows you to remove a role from a specific user or application key. This method only allows the removal of one role per request. The role's ID must be specified on the request path, not on the request body.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The media type of the body of the request. Default value for license manager protocol is application/json

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: ID corresponding to the user

parameters.name: roleId
parameters.description: ID of the role which will be removed from the user

204.description: Success - A no-content response, but the role deletion was performed successfully.

400.description: Bad Request - A userId or role list with invalid format. The message on the body of the response will contain further information.

post.description: Creates a new pair of `appKey` and `appToken`.

get.description: Gets all application keys from an account.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The media type of the body of the request. Default value for license manager protocol is application/json

put.description: Activates or deactivates an `appKey` by its ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID from the appKey which will be updated

example.Message: Token not exists for this account

get.description: Gets the stores and respective hosts of the account

Retrieves information from an account, such as company and sponsor user details, stores, and appTokens.

This endpoint only accepts requests from the host list designated for that store. If you want to try this request from this portal, be sure to add it to the list. Learn how to add hosts to the list in [How to manage accounts](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/how-to-manage-accounts--tutorials_6285#).
Returns a list of registered users. The response is divided in pages. The query parameter `numItems` defines the number of items in each page, and consequently the amount of pages for the whole list.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The media type of the body of the request. Default value for license manager protocol is application/json

parameters.name: numItems
parameters.description: Number of items in the returned page

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: Which page from the whole list will be returned

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Chooses the field that the list will be sorted by

parameters.name: sortType
parameters.description: Defines the sorting order. `ASC` is used for ascendant order. `DSC` is used for descendant order

get.description: Returns a list of available roles. The response is divided in pages. The query parameter `numItems` defines the number of items in each page, and consequently the amount of pages for the whole list.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The media type of the body of the request. Default value for license manager protocol is application/json

parameters.name: numItems
parameters.description: Number of items in the returned page

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: Which page from the whole list will be returned

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Chooses the field that the list will be sorted by

parameters.name: sortType
parameters.description: Defines the sorting order. ASC is used for ascendant order. DSC is used for descendant order

isActive.description: If account is active or not

haveParentAccount.description: If it has a parent account

parentAccountId.description: The ID of the parent account

parentAccountName.description: The name of the parent account

number.description: Number of the address of contact

operationDate.description: The date when the account went into production

inactivationDate.description: The date when the account was deactivated

creationDate.description: The date when the account was created

sites.description: Array of objects representing a store

appKey.description: Deprecated. Check appKeys object for all appKeys

id.description: ID of the category of the license

name.description: Name of the category of the license

SiteItems.description: Object containing complete information from a store

appKey.description: AppKey (Access Key in the license manager UI)

appToken.description: AppToken. For security reasons, should always be null.

createdIn.description: Creation date of the application key

isActive.description: If the application key is active

isBlocked.description: If the application key is blocked

CreatenewappkeyRequest.description: Request body for creating new application key (/api/vlm/appkeys)

CreatenewappkeyResponse.description: Response body of sucessful call to /api/vlm/appkeys

appKey.description: AppKey (Access Key in the license manager UI)

createdIn.description: Date of creation of application key

isActive.description: If the application key is active

UpdateappkeyRequest.description: Request body for activating/deactivating application keys

isActive.description: If the application key should be active or inactive

Getappkeysfromaccount.description: Response body for getting all application keys from the account

appKey.description: AppKey (Access Key in the license manager UI)

createdIn.description: Date of creation of application key

isActive.description: If the application key is active

ListUsersResponse.description: Response body for listing all users

ListRolesResponse.description: Response body for listing all roles

roleType.description: Returns 1 for custom roles, and 0 otherwise

StoreItems.description: Object containing summarized information from a store

hosts.description: Array of hosts corresponding to the store
